description: Defines the structure and requirements for all MDX content in the Physical AI & Humanoid Robotics Lab book

chapters.title: Welcome to the Physical AI Lab
learningObjectives: Understand the book structure and learning objectives
Identify the three core infrastructure components
Recognize the 13-week curriculum progression

chapters.title: High-Level Infrastructure Architecture
learningObjectives: Compare On-Premise vs Cloud-Native lab approaches
Understand the Digital Twin Workstation requirements
Evaluate the Latency Trap implications for real-time applications

chapters.title: ROS 2 Fundamentals: Core Concepts
learningObjectives: Explain ROS 2 node architecture and communication patterns
Define topics, messages, services, and actions
Understand the ROS 2 DDS implementation

chapters.title: Python Implementation with rclpy
learningObjectives: Write basic ROS 2 nodes using rclpy
Implement publisher/subscriber patterns
Create and use ROS 2 services

chapters.title: URDF: Defining Robot Kinematics and Visuals
learningObjectives: Create URDF robot models with links and joints
Define visual and collision geometries
Implement kinematic chains for humanoid robots

chapters.title: Gazebo Classic & Ignition Setup and Bridge
learningObjectives: Install and configure Gazebo simulation environments
Set up ROS 2-Gazebo integration
Configure physics parameters for realistic simulation

chapters.title: Simulating Sensors (LiDAR, IMU, Camera)
learningObjectives: Model common robotics sensors in Gazebo
Configure sensor parameters and noise models
Visualize sensor data in RViz2

chapters.title: Advanced Visualization with Unity
learningObjectives: Integrate Unity with ROS 2 simulation
Create custom visualization environments
Implement physics-based rendering for realistic scenarios

chapters.title: NVIDIA Isaac Sim: Core Environment
learningObjectives: Install and configure Isaac Sim development environment
Set up Omniverse Launcher and Python APIs
Create basic simulation scenarios

chapters.title: Sim-to-Real Transfer Techniques
learningObjectives: Understand domain randomization for robust training
Implement calibration procedures for real robots
Apply transfer learning from simulation to hardware

chapters.title: Humanoid Kinematics and Bipedal Locomotion
learningObjectives: Calculate forward and inverse kinematics for humanoid robots
Implement basic bipedal locomotion patterns
Design control loops for stable walking

chapters.title: Vision-Language-Action (VLA) Architecture
learningObjectives: Integrate LLMs for high-level command interpretation
Implement Whisper for speech recognition
Create vision-language-action pipelines

chapters.title: Capstone Project: Full Stack Integration
learningObjectives: Assemble all modules into integrated humanoid system
Implement end-to-end workflows from perception to action
Validate system performance against curriculum objectives

chapters.title: Workstation & Edge Kit Requirements
learningObjectives: Select appropriate RTX GPU configurations
Specify RAM and storage requirements
Choose Jetson Orin edge computing solutions

chapters.title: Lab Procurement & Cost Analysis
learningObjectives: Analyze CapEx vs OpEx for different deployment models
Create detailed bill of materials for lab setup
Evaluate vendor options and pricing structures

qualityStandards.technicalAccuracy: Must be validated against official documentation
